sentences: Ma olen igatahes õnnelik, et see juhtus.
Igatahes on oluline, et me seda teemat arutame.
Ta oli igatahes rahul, et sai koju jõuda.
context: The word 'igatahes' is commonly used in Estonian to indicate that something is true or happening regardless of other circumstances, and it can be translated to English as 'in any case', 'anyway', or 'at any rate'.
